intro: Heracleum cardiocarpum, commonly known as the heart-fruit cowparn. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. The plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, open habitats.
